description.value:
Trigger a creature within 10 feet can see or hear the cleansing pool

Effect each creature within range must succeed a @Check[will|dc:22] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Fascinated], using all of their available actions to move toward and into the pool. The hazard then rolls initiative.

Trigger a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Fascinated] creature enters the pool

Effect the waters rush up to encircle the creature, which must succeed on a @Check[fortitude|dc:22] save or begin drowning.

stealth.details: (expert) to notice the enticing effects of the pool

details.description: The swirling water in this pool entices anyone who can see or hear it to wander into its depths, drowning its victims.
details.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:24] to scratch out the runes creating the effect, @Check[occultism|dc:20] (expert) or @Check[Demon Lore|dc:20] (expert) to determine the password that identifies the party as believers, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Dispel Magic] (3rd-rank; counteract DC 22); two total successes are required to deactivate the pool.

publication.title: Pathfinder Society Scenario #6-16: The Heart of the City

details.routine:
(1 action; mental) The cleansing pool uses its first action to try and compel all creatures within 5 feet to enter into the pool. Creatures must attempt a @Check[will|dc:20|traits:mental] save.

Critical Success The creature is immune to the pool's routine for 1 minute.

Success No effect.

Failure The creature gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Fascinated] condition and attempts to enter the pool.

Critical Failure As failure, but the creature must also use all of their actions on their next turn to try and pull one of their allies into the pool with them.
